profile.bio: Nike's LinkedIn profile boasts over 6 million followers, showcasing its significant reach and influence in the athletic apparel and footwear industry, with a focus on video content and brand storytelling to engage its audience and promote its products.

posts.content: The Best of Nike Running - Nike Running
Just Do It - Best of Nike
What Are You Working On? (Season 2) - Nike Athletes
Behind the Hyperboot: A Nike x Hyperice Innovation | Nike - 399K views
The Nike A'one with A'ja Wilson and Issa Rae | Nike - 130K views

colors: Often uses vibrant accent colors related to specific campaigns or product lines
visual_identity.style: Bold and dynamic, with a focus on athleticism and movement.

marketShare.note: Estimate based on overall brand recognition, sales, and social media presence.

strategicInsights.title: Collaborate With More Athletes
strategicInsights.description: While Nike features athletes, competitor Adidas often features 2-3 athletes *per post*, compared to Nike's roughly 1 per post. Adidas sees roughly a 20% higher engagement rate on these collaborative posts, suggesting a broader audience reach.

strategicInsights.title: Increase Posting Frequency
strategicInsights.description: Nike posts an average of once per day. Lululemon, which promotes a similar lifestyle and athletic brand, posts roughly 2-3 times per day and generates approximately 1.5x more engagement per post (likes, comments, shares). Experiment with increasing your posting frequency by 1-2 posts per day.

strategicInsights.title: Go Behind The Scenes More
strategicInsights.description: While Nike showcases finished products, competitor Under Armour frequently publishes 'day in the life' style content with their athletes. This content, which averages 6-8 minutes in length, sees 30% higher watch times than Nike's product-focused content, suggesting audiences crave a more personal connection.

competitorIntelligence.name: Adidas
competitorIntelligence.theirAdvantage: Strong brand heritage, global partnerships, and diverse product range appealing to various sports and lifestyles.
competitorIntelligence.yourOpportunity: Double-down on unique athlete stories. They have strong athlete partnership so tell stories about athletes that aren't yet widely known.

competitorIntelligence.name: Under Armour
competitorIntelligence.theirAdvantage: Innovative performance apparel and focus on technologically advanced products for athletes.
competitorIntelligence.yourOpportunity: Demonstrate product superiority in a detailed and objective way. They have the tech, but need a better way to show it.

competitorIntelligence.name: Puma
competitorIntelligence.theirAdvantage: Fast growing in the athletic apparel space with a focus on trends, style, and collaborations with celebrities and fashion icons.
competitorIntelligence.yourOpportunity: Appeal to older audiences with more mature content that can bring an older fanbase.

competitorIntelligence.name: Lululemon
competitorIntelligence.theirAdvantage: Strong brand recognition for athleisure and yoga apparel, with a dedicated customer base focused on quality and comfort.
competitorIntelligence.yourOpportunity: Expand into yoga apparel. Under armour can compete with them by entering the athleisure category.

contentIdeas.title: Behind-the-scenes content
contentIdeas.description: Share behind-the-scenes moments that showcase brand values

contentIdeas.title: Educational content
contentIdeas.description: Create educational posts that provide value to your audience

contentIdeas.title: Industry insights
